page.title: 03Saint Anne's Parish Church
page.content: {Saint Anne's Parish Church}is the oldest and highest building in Catterick Village.It is a stone building and has a tower containing eight bells.On the side of the tower is a chiming clock,and on top is a weather cock.The church stands above the village buildings and is a local landmark. The church was built between 1412 and 1415 and replaced an earlier wooden building. {The bellringers}practise once a week, and the bells are rung regularly each Sunday morning. {The choir}also meets once a week and lead the singing in the services. {The Sunday School}meets each Sunday morning during school term time at 10.30am in the Booth Memorial Institute. The present Vicar is the Rev.G.C. Darvill who is also Rural Dean.
